properties.headline: Concert - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Entertainment Centre
properties.otherAdvice:
Human Nature concert at WIN Entertainment Centre. Show start from 8pm and finish approx 10.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Sports and Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the concert. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

properties.headline: Festival of Steam - THIRLMERE Barbour Road at NSW Rail Museum
properties.otherAdvice:
Thirlmere Festival of Steam at NSW Rail Museum on Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 June. Starts at 10am and finishes 5pm daily.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in the area on roads approaching the festival. Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

On Sunday a street parade will be taking place along Oak Street from 11am. Motorists should follow detours and the directions of traffic controllers while the parade is underway.

properties.headline: Rugby League - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Pacific Test 2022 at Campbelltown Sports Stadium in. Fiji v PNG kick-off from 5:30pm. Samoa v Cook Islands Kick off from 7:30pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V005_04MAY22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v St Kilda at the SCG. First bounce from 7:25pm and full time  at approx. 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match from 4:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Road and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, both open from 4:30pm. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am and last race at 4:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Sutherland2Surf Fun Run and Walk - SUTHERLAND TO CRONULLA via the Kingsway
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting around the closures. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 7,000 participants will take part in the annual Sutherland 2 Surf fun run and walk from Sutherland to Cronulla via the Kingsway from 7.30am. Roads around the start area will close from 5am with all closures in place by 7.40am. Roads progressively reopen from 8.20am, with all roads reopened by 10:30am.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Sutherland from 5am: sections of Flora St and Acacia Rd.
  • Gymea to Cronulla from 7am to 10am: the eastbound lanes of the Kingsway will be closed from the Princes Hwy to Elouera Rd, and will progressively reopen from 8.50am. The speed limit will be reduced to 40km/h on the Kingsway westbound lanes from 7am, delays are expected. Motorists travelling north of the Kingsway should use The Boulevarde/Captain Cook Dr. Motorists travelling south of the Kingsway should use President Ave.
  • Kirrawee from 7am: Bath Rd South, Clements Pde and Oak Rd. The Kingsway will be closed in both directions between Talara Rd and the Princes Hwy from 7.20am to 8.20am.
  • Caringbah from 7am: Banksia Rd, Denman Ave and Yathong Rd.
  • Miranda / Caringbah from 7am: southbound lanes of Kiora Rd, Port Hacking Rd and Taren Point Rd.
  • Woolooware from 7am: Dolans Rd, Fowler St and Hughes St.
  • Cronulla from 5am: Mitchell Rd, Elouera Rd and Prince St. While Elouera Rd is closed between 7.30am and 9:50am access to North Cronulla access is via Captain Cook Dr and access to South Cronulla access is via President Ave and Burraneer Bay Rd.

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections including at Hotham Rd, Milburn Rd/Gymea Bay Rd, Sylvania Rd, Wandella Rd, Kiora Rd, Kareena Rd, Taren Point Rd and Gannons Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in place, however vehicles parked along the route cannot be moved while the event is underway. Greenhills car park in Cronulla will be closed from 4pm Sat 16 July until midday Sun 17 July to accommodate the event finish line.

arrangementElements.html:
From 4pm Saturday 16 July to 12 Midday Sunday 17 July: Greenhills Beach car park from the corner of Mitchell Road and Murdock Street, Cronulla.

properties.headline: Arts Festival - KOGARAH Belgrave Street at Kogarah Town Square
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 35,000 people are expected to visit Un[contained] Arts Festival at Kogarah Town Square from Friday 24 June until Sunday 26 June, from 4:30pm until 10:30pm daily. 

Traffic in the area may be heavier than usual as people travel to and from the event. Belgrave St will be closed between Kensington St and Post Office Ln from 6am Friday 24 June until 6am Monday 27 June.

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic controllers in place, allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: U/19s State of Origin - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
U/19s State of Origin at Leichhardt Oval. Women's match from 6pm followed by Men's match from 7:45pm. Full time approx 9:20pm followed by post match presentations.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Sydney Street Party - SYDNEY Angel Place between Pitt Street AND George Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Street Party event will be held along Angel Place from 12pm to 7pm.

Angel Place will be closed to traffic between Pitt St and George St for the event. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Wests Tigers at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 4:05pm and full-time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Special event - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Sydney Showground
properties.otherAdvice:
Supanova Comic Con & Gaming at Sydney Showground on Saturday 18 and Sunday 19 June from 10am until 6pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Running Festival - WOY WOY TO EAST GOSFORD Brisbane Water Drive
properties.publicTransport: Route 55 buses will be diverted between 8am and 9am via Glenrock Parade. From 7am to 11am buses leaving Gosford Station will be diverted via Baker St, Georgiana Terrace and Dane Dr while Riou St is closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.adviceB: Use diversions; Allow extra travel time
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 3,000 participants will take part in a series of running events from 7am between Woy Woy and Gosford for the annual Bay to Bay Running Festival. Half marathon participants will start at Brisbane Waters Dr, Woy Woy and all races will finish at Grahame Park, East Gosford. 

Key roads will be closed for the event:

  • Dane Drive, Gosford will be closed from approx. 6am until 11:30am.
  • The Riou St/Pacific Hwy on-ramp to the Central Coast Hwy will be closed from 7am to 11am. 
  • Woy Woy to Point Clare from 7:50am to 9:30am: Brisbane Water Dr from Brick Wharf Rd, Woy Woy to the overpass at Kurrawa Ave, Point Clare will be closed. Runners will then continue north via Kurrawa Ave before joining the Central Coast Hwy at Gosford.

Motorists travelling between Gosford and Woy Woy will be diverted via Woy Woy Rd. Local access into Tascott and Koolewong will be via Glenrock Pde.

A number of local roads will also be impacted, including Brick Wharf Rd, Kurrawa Ave, Tascott, Yalambee Ave and Alfred Higgs Pl.

Motorists should avoid the area during the event but if travel is necessary, allow extra travel time and follow the directions of Police and traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Religious Procession - SYDNEY CBD Hunter Street, Macquarie Street, College Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Religious Procession 19 June - Sydney CBD Road Closure and Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Religious Procession 19 June - Sydney CBD Road Closure and Clearway Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in effect for the Walk with Christ Religious Procession in the Sydney CBD between 2.30pm and 4.30pm from Martin Place to St Marys Cathedral.

Traffic will be heavy in the city while roads are closed. Motorists should avoid unnecessary travel through the city where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures:

  • From 2:30pm to 4:30pm – sections of Pitt, O'Connell, Bligh, Castlereagh, Phillip, King, Elizabeth, George and Hunter Streets will close.
  • From 2:50pm to 4:30pm – sections of College St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd and St James Rd will close.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm until 4pm on sections of College, Hunter, Macquarie and Pitt Streets. Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 2.30PM TO 4.30PM

  • Bligh Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place
  • Castlereagh Street between Hunter Street and King Street
  • Elizabeth Street between Market Street and King Street (northbound only)     
  • Elizabeth Street between King Street and Hunter Street
  • George Street between Margaret Street and Hunter Street (southbound only)
  • Hunter Street between George Street and Pitt Street (eastbound only)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street
  • King Street between Phillip Street and Elizabeth Street
  • O’Connell Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street      
  • Phillip Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street 
  • Phillip Street between Hunter Street and King Street      

FROM 2.50PM TO 4.30PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and Park Street      
  • Macquarie Street between Bent Street and St James Road    
  • Prince Albert Road between Macquarie Street and St Mary’s Road
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Macquarie Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones that apply to all vehicle types, and to local residents, businesses or Transport for New South Wales Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 1PM TO 4PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and William Street (eastern side)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street (both sides)
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street (western side)
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place (eastern side)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures and Special Event Clearways
